text: [Music]
hey guys
angel here this week's video I'm going
to show you how to make mochi now this
week's video is also a special request
video so I'm super excited about that
one of my patreon supporters had
requested this and if you don't know
what patreon is it's actually your way
for viewers like you to give back and
support creators like me in making
videos that you guys want to see so one
of the perks through patreon is I have a
special request list set up and every
month I'm going to go through and pick
one from that special request list so
this month I am doing mochi I'm going to
show you guys how to make mochi in two
different flavors a rosca Pina and a
black sesame mochi made the Taiwanese or
hackus pal way it's super super
delicious so I hope you guys keep
watching because this is a really great
mochi recipe so if you're interested in
learning how to make mochi keep watching
and if you're interested in learning
more about how your donations can
support creators like me I'll put a link
to that in the video description below
so let's get started the ingredients for
this recipe is pretty simple you'll need
a bag of glutinous rice flour and look
for this brand because it works well and
it's fairly inexpensive some sugar water
and oil start by measuring out one cup
of the glutinous rice flour and three
tablespoons of cane sugar systems
together first before adding in
three-quarters of a cup of water and one
tablespoon of vegetable oil combine and
stir with a whisk until the liquid
mixture is smooth next bring a pot of
water to boil we're going to use this
other steamer and steam the bowl of
mochi mixture covered on high for 15
minutes and while we're waiting let's
prepare our mochi coating I'm using a
quarter cup of honey roasted peanuts
that I'll crush to make powdered honey
roasted peanuts and I like to leave the
penis a little bit more coarse but it's
totally up to you next I bought some
ground black sesame seeds that I'll put
on another plate plus for a bit of
sweetness I'm going to add a small
amount of cane sugar to mix it
which is totally optional now let's
check in our mochi after 15 minutes your
mochi should look like this it's almost
done but not quite so take a plastic
rice paddle like this and I'm
recommending this plastic rice paddle
because the mochi won't stick to it then
gently stir and mix the mochi for
another round of tini recover and steam
for another 5 minutes or until the mochi
is slightly translucent and no longer
opaque
once it's done remove the bowl and start
to gently knead the mochi kneading the
mochi will help to mix and make the
texture more chewy now comes the fun
part once you have your mochi ready and
the plates of coating prepared start by
spooning out a small amount of the mochi
and passing it back and forth to the
paddle letting the mochi piece fall into
the coating plate repeat this stuff a
few times then using chopsticks gently
roll the mochi balls and cover with the
roasted peanut and sesame mixtures once
you're done serve both flavors on a
plate and prepare to eat these the same
day as mochi is best eaten fresh
[Music]
so that's how you make mochi in two
flavors now if you're wondering mochi is
best eaten the day of but if you really
had to keep it I would wrap it in
plastic wrap and store it someplace cool
if you put in the fridge it's going to
not be as chewy the texture is going to
change so I don't recommend that I
recommend eating it day up or give it to
some friends and family so now for the
taste test I'm going to try both
yeah there's two flavors more to eat I'm
going to try the honey roasted peanut
first okay so if you like honey roasted
peanuts this has a really nice flavor to
it
you've got the honey where's the peanuts
and that combined with the chewy gooey
and slightly warm mochi so good there's
the black sesame
[Music]
to really really go discuss it's really
nutty flavor mochi is so soft it's
slightly sweet very very satisfying it
has really nice umami flavor to it so
that's how you make mochi in two
different flavors give me a thumbs up if
you like this video and don't forget I
post all my recipes on my blog so I've
post a link to that in the video
description below and also if you do end
up try this recipe come back and let me
know what's your favorite black sesame
or honey roasted peanuts I think I like
to black sesame just a tad bit more but
I wanna know what's your favorite until
then take care
and I will see you guys soon bye for now
